content: pompom puff cowl us crochet terms by valerie moreno advanced beginner this is an assigned pooling crochet cowl a continuous loop and color changes make this project fun and interesting use two stitches for the whole project half_double_crochet and the puff after the first row it s vacation crochet the cowl is crocheted in the round it s reversible and there are no seams shaping or counting let the yarn do all the hard work for you this project uses a dk weight yarn and a us j 6 mm hook look for a 2-colored yarn labeled assigned pooling the main color usually is about 70% of the hank with the contrast color pooled in one section the remaining 30% the pattern is written for 2 sizes small and large for a 1-skein project make the small it fits close to the neck the large uses 2-skeins and will give you the most versatility wear it looped double around your shoulders like a shrug or crossed in the front the yarn has 2 colors a main color and a contrast color the project uses 2 corresponding stitches when you work with the main color make half double crochets at the contrast color make the bobble puff for me the bobble puff is the easiest to make and my hook slides through the loops the foundation half_double_crochet beginning takes a little concentration and it s worth the extra effort the bottom and top edges match and it s a stretchy edge use this written pattern as a starting point the idea is so easy to change or customize if you prefer a medium size loop start with an in-between stitch count sometimes it helps to use your favorite cowl as a guide you can stop when your project is just the right size or when you run out of yarn if bobble puffs aren t your jam you could substitute a different stitch choose a textured stitch that begins and ends in the same stitch to maintain the stitch count the sample is shown in the large size using 2 full skeins 200 gm of yarn photo credit valerie moreno size adult s l finished measurements circumference
